description: Many Nintendo-developed games for the Wii U and Switch use an audio framework known as AAL. Some of these games include:

Games that use AAL store audio and audio-related data in a variety of proprietary file formats, including the BAGST format. Each BAGST file controls certain settings for a related group of audio files (such as a group of in-game sound effects or a group of in-game songs). These settings include the audio's default volume, pitch, limiter and ducker settings, and more.
